explanation: To determine whether OS_BinSemCreate_Impl is recursive (directly or indirectly) you must examine all functions it calls transitively. The static call graph for this function shows a single direct callee: OS_ObjectIndexFromToken. Therefore the implementation and call relationships of OS_ObjectIndexFromToken are required so the next agent can check whether that function (or anything it calls) can lead back to OS_BinSemCreate_Impl. Other symbols referenced in the body (pthread_*, memset, strerror, OS_DEBUG, OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET, etc.) are library/macro calls that do not appear in the static call graph as OS callees and so are not needed to establish whether there is an indirect call back to OS_BinSemCreate_Impl.
